meanings.definition: The act of keeping money for future use.
meanings.sent1: My mom taught me the importance of saving money for emergencies.
meanings.sent2: I have a piggy bank where I keep all my saving for a rainy day.
meanings.sent3: I was saving my allowance to buy a new toy, but then I saw a cute puppy for sale!
meanings.sent4: She viewed her saving as a safety net, protecting her from unexpected expenses.
meanings.sent5: The habit of saving can lead to financial security in the long run.

meanings.sent1: The thick walls of the castle provided a saving barrier against invaders.
meanings.sent2: The firefighter's quick action was a saving grace for the family trapped inside.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's saving powers were put to the test when a meteor threatened the city.
meanings.sent4: The umbrella was a saving shield from the pouring rain.
meanings.sent5: The life jacket was a saving flotation device for the struggling swimmer.

meanings.sent1: I like all fruits, saving bananas - they make me itchy.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed the movie, saving the ending which she found disappointing.
meanings.sent3: He was excited to go to the party, saving he had to finish his homework first.
meanings.sent4: The trip was fun, saving the long bus ride back home.
meanings.sent5: The cake was delicious, saving it was a bit too sweet for her taste.
